article.headline: W. Carolina 60, Presbyterian 57
article.story: CULLOWHEE, N.C. (AP) -- Brandon Giles scored 17 points to help Western Carolina recover from a halftime deficit and beat Presbyterian College 60-57 on Thursday night. Blake Gallagher added 12 points and 12 rebounds for the Catamounts (4-7). Pierre Miller led Presbyterian (1-15) with a career-high 16 points. Josh Johnson, who had 10 points, scored with 20 seconds remaining to bring Presbyterian within one. But Western Carolina's Jake Robinson hit two free throws with 11 seconds left, and Presbyterian's Pat Kiscaden missed a final shot at the buzzer. The Blue Hose led 27-24 at halftime after going 6-of-15 from behind the 3-point line. The Catamounts started the second half on a 7-2 run. Both teams finished the game shooting 39 percent from the field.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
